page.title: 10Tourism in Canterbury
page.content: Tourism is Canterbury's main attraction. The{shops,}hotels, and restaurants depend on tourists. Last year 2-2.5 million people went there, many of these from the USA and parts of the continent. Many came from other parts of Britain. The main attraction is the{Cathedral,}because of the stained glass windows, Norman crypt, and also because it is called the cradle of Christianity.There are other buildings such as Grey Friars, the Dominican Priory and Black Friars. Others include 2 small{museums}- Westgate garden and the Dane John mound (a saxon burial place). Tourists love the old mediaeval houses, the Roman City Wall, the shops, and trips along the river. A guest house or{hotel}can range in price from Â£62.50 per night for a hotel to Â£19.00 for a guest house.
